physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate (bpm): 388, QRS duration (ms): 9.8 (normalized), QT interval (ms): 48.5, QTc interval (ms): 38.9
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: ECG demonstrated unusually slow atrial flutter; hypotension noted during exertion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After catheter ablation, developed atrial standstill and prolonged QRS duration.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate (bpm): 317, QRS duration (ms): 33.4, QT interval (ms): 77.9, QTc interval (ms): 55.9
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Second degree or higher atrioventricular block, sinus node dysfunction, normal QT interval.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Prolongation of P-wave duration, PR interval, and QRS duration progressed with age; ventricular tachycardia observed in DN/DN mice.
